1.text: Pour 1 cup (240 ml) of clear glue into a mixing bowl.

2.text: Measure out 2 US tbsp (30 ml) of metallic paint to put into the bowl.

3.text: Stir the mixture until it’s thoroughly combined.

4.text: Mix liquid starch in slowly until you’re satisfied with the consistency.

5.text: Take the slime out of the bowl and knead it with your hands.

6.text: Add 1 cup (240 ml) of white glue to a mixing bowl.

7.text: Mix roughly 3 cups (710 ml) of shaving cream into the bowl.

8.text: Pour metallic paint into the bowl until you reach your desired color.

9.text: Add contact lens solution in small amounts to firm up the slime.

10.text: Knead the slime using your hands when it’s no longer sticky.

11.text: Pour 1 cup (240 ml) of clear glue into a bowl.

12.text: Mix 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of baking soda into the glue.

13.text: Pour contact lens solution into the bowl slowly while mixing it.

14.text: Knead the slime with your hands to continue mixing the ingredients.

15.text: Sprinkle metallic powder into the slime and twist it to spread the pigment.
